meanings.definition: People or animals of pure or unmixed ancestry.
meanings.sent1: The zoo proudly displayed the fullbloods of the endangered species.
meanings.sent2: The ranch only bred fullbloods to maintain the purity of the breed.
meanings.sent3: The fullbloods at the dog show were so well-behaved, they stole the spotlight.
meanings.sent4: In the world of thoroughbred horses, fullbloods are highly sought after for their superior genetics.
meanings.sent5: The fullbloods in the wildlife sanctuary were a testament to the preservation of their species.

meanings.definition: Describing someone or something that is purebred or of unmixed lineage.
meanings.sent1: The fullbloods dogs were known for their loyalty and intelligence.
meanings.sent2: The farmer preferred fullbloods chickens for their robust health and productivity.
meanings.sent3: The fullbloods cat strutted around the neighborhood like a royal feline.
meanings.sent4: Her fullbloods heritage was evident in her striking features and graceful demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The fullbloods roses in the garden bloomed with vibrant colors and strong fragrance.
